ul.li:
Include these codes as defined in http://smart.who.int/immunizations/CodeSystem/DT
CodeDisplayDefinition
Countries where varicella is an important public health burden could consider introducing varicella vaccination in the routine childhood immunization programme. However, resources should be sufficient to ensure reaching and sustaining vaccine coverage ≥ 80%. Decision-making on childhood varicella vaccination should also include consideration of the possible impact on herpes zoster.The number of doses recommended is dependent on the goal of the vaccination programme. One dose is sufficient to reduce mortality and severe morbidity from varicella but not to prevent limited virus circulation and outbreaks. Two doses have higher effectiveness and should therefore be recommended in countries where the programmatic goal is, in addition to decreasing mortality and severe morbidity, to further reduce the number of cases and outbreaks.The number of doses recommended is dependent on the goal of the vaccination programme. One dose is sufficient to reduce mortality and severe morbidity from varicella but not to prevent limited virus circulation and outbreaks. Two doses have higher effectiveness and should therefore be recommended in countries where the programmatic goal is, in addition to decreasing mortality and severe morbidity, to further reduce the number of cases and outbreaks.

title.value: Decision Table for IMMZ.D2.DT.Varicella.1dose. Autogenerated from DAK artifacts

description.value: Value Set for Decision Table for IMMZ.D2.DT.Varicella.1dose. Autogenerated from DAK artifacts. Autogenerated from DAK artifacts

code.value: Countries where varicella is an important public health burden could consider introducing varicella vaccination in the routine childhood immunization programme. However, resources should be sufficient to ensure reaching and sustaining vaccine coverage ≥ 80%. Decision-making on childhood varicella vaccination should also include consideration of the possible impact on herpes zoster.
Number of varicella primary series doses administered
Client is not due for varicella vaccination
Should not vaccinate client with varicella dose as clients age is less than 12 months.
No varicella primary series dose was administered
Should not vaccinate client with varicella dose as live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks.
Client is due for varicella vaccination
Should vaccinate client with varicella dose as no varicella dose was administered, client is within the appropriate age range and no live vaccine was administered in past 4 weeks.
One varicella primary series dose was administered
Varicella immunization schedule is complete. One varicella primary series dose was administered.
